title: Religions Today: Hinduism Hardback (Living Religions)
description: One of a series that focuses on major religions and their relevance to contemporary life. It offers a balance of information about each religion and an exploration of how we can learn from it. The text looks at the founders and significant individuals in the religion and its key beliefs, signs and symbols. Worship is also covered, the festivals, celebrations, rites of passage, pilgrimages and sacred places. Moral issues and ultimate questions are presented and considered. The concepts explored in the "Living Religions" series are presented here in a simplified and more accessible text.

title: Gordon Strachan's Soccer Skills: A Complete Step-by-step Guide
description: As a fully qualified coach, midfielder Gordon Strachan has strongly-held views on how youngsters should be taught to play soccer, and he puts these across in this book of footballing skills, covering everything from dribbling to penalties, and from corners to shooting.

title: Every Day A Thousand Times
description: This little book is based on the Friday portion of Dalailu l-Khayrat by Imam al-Jazuli. It is composed of rhyming rhythmical verses, some with a refrain that makes it fun to read along with children. It is meant to be read to young children as a goodnight book. It can be read by older children as a prayer book, an introduction to salawatu n-Nabi as both a concept and a practice . The verses are accompanied by bright color photographs of the natural world. There is a playful addendum on the use of numbers, an exploration of the vastness of creation, for the fun and information of older children.

title: Anne Marbury Hutchinson: Religious Leader (135) (1000 Readers)
description: Anne Marbury Hutchinson is a role model for any person who believes in the rights of the individual to freedom of thought, freedom of speech, and freedom to worship. Her faith and her bravery to stand up for what she believed in inspired many others to defend her and to follow her. Anne was also one of the first English colonists to settle in Rhode Island.These popular readers include easy-to-read information, fun facts and trivia, humor, activities and a whole lot more. They are great for ages 7-12 (grades 2-6), because although simple, these readers have substance and really engage kids with their stories. They are great for social studies, meeting state and national curriculum standards, individual and group reading programs, centers, library programs, and have many other terrific educational uses. title: Disney Scary Storybook Collection (Storybook Collections)
description: 4 books in 1! Get ready for scary fun. Based on characters from Toy Story, Alice in Wonderland, Mickey and Friends, and Sleeping Beauty, this creepy storybook collection is sure to give you chills!
